author: Eliot Brown
title: SoftBank Bets Big on Food Delivery
text:
SoftBank Group Corp., the Japanese conglomerate that has barreled into Silicon Valley with unprecedented sums of cash for startups, is now betting big on food delivery.

The company’s $92 billion Vision Fund and other investors—including a Singapore sovereign-wealth fund and Sequoia Capital—have committed to invest $535 million in San Francisco-based food delivery service DoorDash Inc., a major infusion for the five-year-old company. Tony Xu, DoorDash’s chief executive, said money would be used to expand to about 1,600 cities,... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
